landing.tagline: Map intergenerational trauma onto visual family trees.
landing.about: Traumatrees is a personal reflection tool for exploring patterns of trauma across generations. Build your family tree, record events, and visualize how experiences ripple through time.
landing.privacy: Everything you enter is encrypted on your device before it ever reaches our server. We use zero-knowledge encryption, meaning we cannot read your data, even if we wanted to. Your encryption passphrase is the only key that can unlock your information. We don't store it, and we can't recover it. If you lose your passphrase, your data is gone forever. This is by design: your story belongs to no one but you.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.collect.heading: What we collect
privacy.collect.body: When you create an account, we store your email address and a hashed version of your password for authentication purposes. We also store an encryption salt used to derive your personal encryption key. When you use the app, we store your tree data (persons, relationships, events) as encrypted blobs that we cannot read. We record login timestamps to monitor service health and detect abuse.
privacy.collect.glance: We store your email, a scrambled version of your password, and your tree data in encrypted form that we cannot read.
privacy.cannotAccess.heading: What we cannot access
privacy.cannotAccess.body: All tree content (names, birth years, relationship details, trauma event descriptions, and any other information you enter) is encrypted on your device before it reaches our server. We store this data as opaque ciphertext. We have no way to decrypt, read, or analyse your content. Even under a legal order, we could not produce your plaintext data because we do not have your encryption key.
privacy.cannotAccess.glance: We can never read your names, dates, relationships, or events. Everything is encrypted before it leaves your device. Even if ordered by a court, we could not hand over your data.
privacy.encryption.heading: How encryption works
privacy.encryption.body: When you register, you choose an encryption passphrase separate from your login password. This passphrase, combined with a random salt, derives a 256-bit AES-GCM encryption key using Argon2id (a memory-hard key derivation function). The key exists only in your browser's memory while you are logged in. Every piece of data is encrypted with a fresh random initialisation vector before being sent to the server. When you close the tab or log out, the key is discarded. We never store, transmit, or log your passphrase or encryption key.
privacy.encryption.glance: Your passphrase creates a secret key that lives only in your browser while you are logged in. When you close the tab, the key is gone. We never see it.
privacy.hosting.heading: Hosting and infrastructure
privacy.hosting.body: The application runs on Google Cloud Platform (Cloud Run and Cloud SQL) in the EU. Email verification messages are sent via SMTP. We do not use any third-party analytics, tracking scripts, advertising networks, or content delivery networks that process your data.
privacy.hosting.glance: Our servers run in the EU on Google Cloud. We use no analytics, no trackers, and no advertising networks.
privacy.cookies.heading: Cookies and local storage
privacy.cookies.body: We do not use cookies. We store two JSON Web Tokens (authentication tokens) in your browser's local storage to keep you logged in. These tokens contain your user ID and expiration time; no personal content. We do not use any third-party scripts that set cookies or track your behaviour.
privacy.cookies.glance: No cookies. We only store a login token in your browser to keep you signed in. No tracking of any kind.
privacy.retention.heading: Data retention
privacy.retention.body: Your data is stored for as long as your account exists. If you delete your account, all associated data (encrypted blobs, login records, and account information) is permanently removed from our systems.
privacy.retention.glance: Your data exists as long as your account does. Delete your account and everything is permanently removed.
privacy.rights.heading: Your rights
privacy.rights.body: Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the right to access your personal data, rectify inaccurate data, request erasure of your data, restrict or object to processing, and receive your data in a portable format. You also have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority. Note that for encrypted content, you already have full access through the app; we cannot provide a plaintext copy because we do not have one.
privacy.rights.glance: Under GDPR, you can access, correct, or delete your data at any time. Since everything is encrypted, you already have full access through the app.
